bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Walker et al. Summary of Case
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: back and found man with other train hands was after two o'clock: fees jar of engine am not experienced enough to say whether engine would jar if body was run over before ours passed over it: first man that was ever run over prince I commenced firing--

M.A. Walker- Musician: sworn: testifies: Have played with deceased for some time: his name is Wm Lockwood and he is about my own age: I got home from Port Townsend about twelve o'cl. last night: ticard engine stop in front of my house about two and remarked to my wife that I considered it strange: then heard men talking and someone hollered to me "to get up that a man was run over": Mr Lockwood has been in the habit of drinking heavily: he never wanted to go home when not sober: don't know how he got where he lay:

Charles Walker- sworn testifies: Live at same house as M A Walker does: am a brother of his: Mr Lockwood was at our house last night until about twelve oclock when he proceeded to take some ladies home among whom was Mrs Stuner: he asked to stay all night and we expected him back: (was intoxicated to slight degree) (statement qualified) was in the habit of drinking: the body was found in front of our house: cannot account for how it got there: shortest was in returning from ladies home to our house was in front by way of the track_ he must have wandered past the house to the peace where he was run over
